query: A car rear ended another car.
response:
This accident report involves a rear-end collision between two vehicles, resulting in injuries to the driver of one vehicle. The incident took place during daylight hours on a rural two-lane roadway approaching a three-legged intersection. 

The first vehicle involved was a 2014 Honda Civic two-door coupe, driven by an unrestrained 21-year-old female. The second vehicle was a 2012 Chevrolet Cruze four-door sedan, which was stopped in the northbound lane waiting to turn westbound onto the intersecting road. 

As the driver of the Honda Civic attempted to avoid colliding with the stationary Chevrolet Cruze, she steered left and braked but ultimately collided with its rear end. This initial impact caused her vehicle to enter into the southbound lane where it then collided head-on with a 2012 Honda Civic traveling in that direction.

Both vehicles sustained significant damage and had to be towed from the scene. The driver of the Honda Civic suffered moderate injuries as a result of this multi-vehicle collision.

Weather conditions were cloudy at the time of the crash, and both roadways were dry with speed limits posted at 89 kmph (55 mph). There were no traffic controls present on either roadway leading up to the intersection where this accident occurred.

Overall, this rear-end collision resulted in multiple impacts and serious injuries to one individual involved in this unfortunate chain of events.

query: A car rear ended another car.
response:
On [date and time], a three-vehicle accident occurred on a rural two-lane roadway approaching a three-legged intersection. The crash involved a moderately-injured, unrestrained, 21-year-old female driver of a 2014 Honda Civic two-door coupe, which rear-ended a 2012 Chevrolet Cruze four-door sedan. Following the initial impact, the frontal plane of the Honda Civic collided with the front of a 2012 Honda Civic two-door coupe.

The weather at the time of the accident was cloudy, and the asphalt roadway was dry with a speed limit of 89 kmph (55 mph). There were no traffic controls on the north/south roadway where the collision took place. Vehicle 1 (Honda Civic) was traveling in the left northbound travel lane while Vehicle 2 (Chevrolet Cruze) was stopped in that same lane waiting to head west onto an intersecting road. Meanwhile, Vehicle 3 (Honda Civic) was traveling southbound in its designated lane.

The driver of Vehicle 1 attempted to avoid hitting Vehicle 2 by steering left and braking but ended up colliding with its rear end before veering into oncoming traffic and striking Vehicle 3's frontal plane. Both Vehicles 1 and Vehicles were towed from scene due to disabling damage.

This accident report highlights how failure to maintain safe following distances can lead to chain reaction collisions resulting in injuries and significant vehicle damage. It serves as an important reminder for drivers to stay vigilant on roads at all times to prevent such incidents from occurring again.

query: A car rear ended another car.
response:
This crash case involves a rear-end collision between a 2018 Toyota Camry sedan and a 2016 Honda Accord sedan. The driver of the Toyota Camry, a 35-year-old male, rear-ended the Honda Accord while both vehicles were traveling on a busy city street during rush hour. The weather conditions at the time of the accident were clear, and the road surface was dry.

The impact caused damage to the rear bumper of the Honda Accord and front bumper of the Toyota Camry. Both drivers reported feeling minor neck pain following the collision but declined medical treatment at the scene. Law enforcement arrived shortly after to document the incident and assist with traffic control.

Both vehicles were able to be driven from the scene, although they sustained moderate damage in the collision. The driver of the Toyota Camry was found to be at fault for failing to maintain a safe following distance and avoid colliding with stopped traffic ahead.

Overall, this rear-end collision resulted in minor injuries and vehicle damage but did not lead to any serious consequences for those involved.
